results.title: Steel
results.brief_description: A picture of the British steel industry showing all stages in the manufacture of steel from the mining of iron ore to the finished products ranging from small precision instruments to vast keels for ocean-going vessels.

results.title: Portrait of Paula
results.brief_description: Paula, an engineer in New York, talks about herself while photographs of her as a child, her family and her wedding are shown. Paula discusses her marriage and human relationships, equal opportunity, women in the work-force, problems of management and her other interests in art and sailing.

results.title: Maps we live by
results.brief_description: This is a film about the common language of maps, and the ways in which maps unite both the affairs and minds of men of all nations. It is an essay on the increasing interdependence of the nations of the world. This is not a technical film of instruction.

results.title: My financial career
results.creator_credit: Gerald Potterton, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon film from Stephen Leacock’s witty account of a young man’s first brush with banking. When he goes to make his deposit he is so overawed by the institution that nothing he intends to say comes out right. (Awards: Oscar nomination, Hollywood; San Francisco; New York)

results.title: The Lollipop opera by Don Freeman
results.brief_description: A lively film about a barber who draws his own shop, adds a “Mop Top” customer, then cuts and shampoos the boy’s unmanageable hair, finally rewarding him with a lollipop for his good behaviour. Rossini’s “Barber of Seville” provides a lively musical accompaniament. No dialogue. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Breakdown
results.creator_credit: Peter Thurley, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fictional film about two people and a salamander. The car they are travelling in collapses unceremoniously on the road to Montreal. Finding a mechanic in the quiet countryside is never easy, but here the problem is compounded by linguistic misunderstandings. Eventually the car runs again, but one of the passengers refuses to run along.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Thurley, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Nicaragua 1979: scenes from the revolution
results.brief_description: Documents the Sandinista uprising from the general strike of June 1979 through the first hundred days of reconstruction after the victory. A fast-paced “on the spot” film which eloquently captures the furious demise of the Somoza dynasty in its desperate attempt to turn back the tide of history, and which also paints a powerful portrait of the forces at work within the Nicaraguan revolution.

results.title: The History of the world in three minutes flat
results.creator_credit: Michael Mills and Michael Mills Productions
results.brief_description: Uses vignettes from the past and animators’ licence to provide a humorous account of history as seen through the eyes of “The Creator”. With animation by Jim Hiltz, Bill Speers, Rick Bowman and John Gaug.

results.title: Equality. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Art Ciocco, Paul Buck, Ken Stein, Best Films and New Jersey Public Television
results.brief_description: Explores the diversity of people and the breadth of the problems as one searches for “equality”. Concentrates on the basic areas of economics, ethnic groups, problems of old age and alternate lifestyle. Contains some b&w sequences.

results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part two, conductor Verdon Williams discusses the tasks that a conductor must do before each performance - choosing the number and type of instruments needed; studying the melody and style of the music. Shows him rehearsing an orchestra and a choir.
